title: Senior Benefits Specialist
description: Under the direction of the Senior Director of Benefits, the Senior Benefits Specialist is responsible for assisting with the administration of all benefits including but not limited to: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, leaves of absence, and retirement programs (401(k) plan and defined pension plan) and COBRA. The Senior Benefits Specialist requires in-depth knowledge of benefits regulations - federal and state laws that govern them. Point of contact for employee benefit inquiries and seeking solutions for issues that may arise.Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Assist with the administration of the health and welfare plan including wellness programs (i.e., benefits fairs), leave of absences (i.e., employees (FMLA, PFL, Worker's Compensation, Military, Short/Long Term Disability), and COBRA administration.Point of contact for employee benefit inquiries and seeking solutions for issues that may arise.Assist with various audits (Worker's Compensation in state and out of state, retirement plans (401K and pension and union benefits audit).Process forms, system data entry (i.e. HRIS, benefits portals, employer carrier systems) and ensure the accuracy of all benefits enrollments and changes.Process benefits enrollment for new hires, employee changes, and benefit terminations.Prepare and maintain employee benefit files, ensuring accuracy, compliance and confidentially, maintain benefit section of HRIS.Set up employees' benefits payroll deductions. Collaborating with Payroll/Finance and other departments to ensure billing and payroll deductions are handled timely and accurately.Assist with the benefits orientation and open enrollment processes.Assist with all benefit-related documents and setup in HRIS and benefits portal.Monitor/audit all benefit-related payroll deductions and adjustments, ensuring accuracy.Assist with the preparations and submission of government-mandated reports.Assist in processing assigned benefits-related billings, and coordinate the funding with the accounting department.Assist with communication and education to employees regarding benefit programs.Assist in preparing metrics reports.Research, resolve and respond to all benefit related issues in a timely and accurate manner.Coordinate annual discrimination testing with benefits broker.Participate in the planning and development of the overall benefits programs.Assist with the renewal process of insurance plans and coordinate the open enrollment process.Prepare and assemble plan communication materials for new participants and terminating participants.Assist with defined pension plan calculations.Assist with the coordination of the Annual Open Enrollment.The expected salary range for the Sr. Benefits Specialist is $75,000 - 95,000. The AMNH offers an extensive benefits package designed to meet the needs of our dedicated and diverse community. Pay will be determined based on several factors. The hiring range for the position at commencement is based on the type of work and the scope of responsibilities. The salary and placement offered is based on a number of individualized factors, including, but not limited to, skills, knowledge, training, education, credentials, areas of specialization and depth and scope of experience.
